Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Grounds_for_Claim: Retaliation for previous human rights complaints, discrimination based on national origin and disability
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Commission's decision
Evidence_Requirement: Timely filing of complaint or demonstration of exceptional circumstances for late filing
Institutional_Action: Commission declined to deal with out-of-time complaint
Exemptions_or_Defenses_Cited: No exceptional circumstances justifying late filing
Evidence_Type: Complaint filing date, termination date, internal appeal process timeline
Personal_Data_Implicated: National origin, disability status, employment history
Assessment_Standard: One-year time limit for filing complaints unless exceptional circumstances apply
Complaint_Issues: Late filing, procedural fairness, reasonableness of decision
Protected_Group: Persons with disabilities, ethnic/national origin groups
Legal_Standard: Patently unreasonable standard applied to Commission's decision
Protection_Claim: Protection from retaliation and discrimination under human rights law
State_Protection_Assessment: Available but contingent on compliance with procedural requirements
Risk_Factor: Retaliation for prior complaints, systemic discrimination
Legal_Provision: Section of the Canadian Human Rights Act regarding time limits for complaints
Targeted_Group: Individual based on disability and national origin
State_Protection_Adequacy: Procedures in place, but strict adherence to timelines enforced
Enforcement_Action: Judicial review denied; no further action by Commission
Legal_Basis: Violation of anti-discrimination and anti-retaliation provisions
